verses.text: But of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you.

similars.text: But as touching brotherly love ye need not that I write unto you: for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another.

verses.text: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.

similars.text: But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.

But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.
Therefore, gird up your loins, that you may be the children of light, and that day shall not overtake you as a thief.
And again, verily I say unto you, the coming of the Lord draweth nigh, and it overtaketh the world as a thief in the night--
And again, verily I say unto you, the coming of the Lord draweth nigh, and it overtaketh the world as a thief in the night--
Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.

But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.
Watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning:
Watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh.

verses.text: For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.

similars.text: Destruction cometh; and they shall seek peace, and there shall be none.

verses.text: But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.

similars.text: Therefore, gird up your loins, that you may be the children of light, and that day shall not overtake you as a thief.
For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.
Therefore, gird up your loins, that you may be the children of light, and that day shall not overtake you as a thief.

verses.text: Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.

similars.text: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord: walk as children of light:

verses.text: Therefore let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober.
For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.

similars.text: And when the night came they were drunken with anger, even as a man who is drunken with wine; and they slept again upon their swords.
Wo unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink, that continue until night, and wine inflame them!
Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night, till wine inflame them!

verses.text: But let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation.
For God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,

similars.text: For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness.
For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.
Not unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truth's sake.
And not only so, but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the atonement.

verses.text: Who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

similars.text: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:
Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:

verses.text: Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.

similars.text: Wherefore comfort one another with these words.
Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.
Wherefore, he that preacheth and he that receiveth, understand one another, and both are edified and rejoice together.
Therefore, let your hearts be comforted; for all things shall work together for good to them that walk uprightly, and to the sanctification of the church.
Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity. Peace be with you all that are in Christ Jesus. Amen.
Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.
Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?
Wherefore comfort one another with these words.

verses.text: And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;

similars.text: Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,
We then, as workers together with him, beseech you also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.
And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.
Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all men.

verses.text: And to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake. And be at peace among yourselves.
Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all men.

similars.text: And now my beloved brethren, I would exhort you to have patience, and that ye bear with all manner of afflictions; that ye do not revile against those who do cast you out because of your exceeding poverty, lest ye become sinners like unto them;
And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient,

And now my beloved brethren, I would exhort you to have patience, and that ye bear with all manner of afflictions; that ye do not revile against those who do cast you out because of your exceeding poverty, lest ye become sinners like unto them;
And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;

verses.text: See that none render evil for evil unto any man; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.

similars.text: Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.
Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:
For your obedience is come abroad unto all men. I am glad therefore on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple concerning evil.

Yea, and I know that good and evil have come before all men; he that knoweth not good from evil is blameless; but he that knoweth good and evil, to him it is given according to his desires, whether he desireth good or evil, life or death, joy or remorse of conscience.
Wherefore, honest men and wise men should be sought for diligently, and good men and wise men ye should observe to uphold; otherwise whatsoever is less than these cometh of evil.

And whatsoever thing persuadeth men to do good is of me; for good cometh of none save it be of me. I am the same that leadeth men to all good; he that will not believe my words will not believe me--that I am; and he that will not believe me will not believe the Father who sent me. For behold, I am the Father, I am the light, and the life, and the truth of the world.
Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.

verses.text: Rejoice evermore.

similars.text: Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.
Blessed be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.

verses.text: Pray without ceasing.
In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.

similars.text: Behold, this is the will of the Lord your God concerning you. Even so. Amen.
I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
Thou shalt thank the Lord thy God in all things.
And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
And ye must give thanks unto God in the Spirit for whatsoever blessing ye are blessed with.
Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.
Behold, this is sufficient for you, and the will of him who hath sent you.
Now thanks be unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.
First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.
I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.

I say unto you, my brethren, that if you should render all the thanks and praise which your whole soul has power to possess, to that God who has created you, and has kept and preserved you, and has caused that ye should rejoice, and has granted that ye should live in peace one with another--
For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
Verily, thus saith the Lord unto you who have assembled yourselves together to receive his will concerning you:

But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:
For your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;
We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is meet, because that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the charity of every one of you all toward each other aboundeth;
And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.
I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
And ye must give thanks unto God in the Spirit for whatsoever blessing ye are blessed with.
And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.text: Quench not the Spirit.
Despise not prophesyings.
Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.
Abstain from all appearance of evil.

similars.text: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

verses.text: And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

similars.text: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy: for I am the Lord your God.
Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

For I am the Lord your God: ye shall therefore sanctify yourselves, and ye shall be holy; for I am holy: neither shall ye defile yourselves with any manner of creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.
Therefore, let your hearts be comforted concerning Zion; for all flesh is in mine hands; be still and know that I am God.

I say unto you, my brethren, that if you should render all the thanks and praise which your whole soul has power to possess, to that God who has created you, and has kept and preserved you, and has caused that ye should rejoice, and has granted that ye should live in peace one with another--
Preserve my soul; for I am holy: O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee.
Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.

I am mindful of you always in my prayers, continually praying unto God the Father in the name of his Holy Child, Jesus, that he, through his infinite goodness and grace, will keep you through the endurance of faith on his name to the end.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
And ye shall keep my statutes, and do them: I am the Lord which sanctify you.
That ye may remember, and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God.
Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

verses.text: Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.

similars.text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man's, who shall give you that which is your own?
Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:
Behold, this is the promise of the Father unto you if you continue faithful.
And it shall come to pass, that if you are faithful you shall receive the fulness of the record of John.

verses.text: Brethren, pray for us.

similars.text: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,
Now I beseech you, brethren, for the Lord Jesus Christ's sake, and for the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for me;
Behold, O Lord, their souls are precious, and many of them are our brethren; therefore, give unto us, O Lord, power and wisdom that we may bring these, our brethren, again unto thee.
Brethren, my heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is, that they might be saved.

Wherefore, my beloved brethren, pray unto the Father with all the energy of heart, that ye may be filled with this love, which he hath bestowed upon all who are true followers of his Son, Jesus Christ; that ye may become the sons of God; that when he shall appear we shall be like him, for we shall see him as he is; that we may have this hope; that we may be purified even as he is pure. Amen.
Brethren, let every man, wherein he is called, therein abide with God.
Behold, my beloved brethren, remember the words of your God; pray unto him continually by day, and give thanks unto his holy name by night. Let your hearts rejoice.
Therefore, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our affliction and distress by your faith:

And now, my beloved brethren, I perceive that ye ponder still in your hearts; and it grieveth me that I must speak concerning this thing. For if ye would hearken unto the Spirit which teacheth a man to pray, ye would know that ye must pray; for the evil spirit teacheth not a man to pray, but teacheth him that he must not pray.
Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have free course, and be glorified, even as it is with you:
